intro: Polygonum nudum, commonly known as the common knotgrass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant has alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often slightly hairy on the upper surface. Its small, greenish flowers are clustered in spikes and bloom in late summer. Polygonum nudum is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in open fields, where it thrives in full sun.
